p: We used antibiotics as a positive control: cefoxitin for Gram-negative (G -) bacteria and gentamicin for Gram-positive (G +) bacteria, and fluconazole for yeast. From G - we used SE, Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica; PA, Pseudomonas aeruginosa; and YE, Yersinia enterocolitica. From G +, we used SA, Staphylococcus subsp. aureus; EF, Enterococcus faecalis; and SP, Streptococcus pneumoniae. From yeast, CA, Candida albicans; CK, Candida krusei; and CT, Candida tropicalis were used. The method has been described previously [ 29].
